N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 3.35 - Public schools

State Regulations
(a) No
school district shall receive any apportionment of funds unless it submits all
required reports, maintains an approved course of study, provides a school
building and site in conformity with the requirements of the Education Law, the
rules of the Regents and the regulations of the commissioner, and meets all
other requirements of law. No school district shall receive any apportionment
of funds based upon attendance of pupils at a secondary school unless such
school: (1)
makes general use of the Regents
examinations in the senior high school grades; and
(2)
requires each class throughout its course
to have during each school week a minimum of four recitations in English, which
shall include the study of the language and literature and practice in
composition. (b) Nothing
in this section shall prohibit an apportionment to any school whose courses
have been approved and whose examinations are accepted in lieu of Regents
examinations, provided such schools meet all other requirements, or an
apportionment to duly chartered and registered libraries pursuant to
law. Notes
